meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a hologynic organism.
meanings.sent1: The hologynic flower had both male and female parts on the same plant.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the hologynic behavior of the single-celled organism.
meanings.sent3: The hologynic tree seemed confused about its gender identity.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was hologynic, displaying traits of both introversion and extroversion.
meanings.sent5: The hologynic bird was a unique blend of colors, unlike any other in the forest.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a hologynic system.
meanings.sent1: The hologynic process allowed for efficient energy distribution.
meanings.sent2: The company implemented a hologynic approach to improve communication.
meanings.sent3: The hologynic software seamlessly integrated various functions.
meanings.sent4: Their teamwork was hologynic, each member contributing equally to the project.
meanings.sent5: The hologynic network connected all devices wirelessly, creating a seamless experience.

meanings.sent1: The hologynic wasp exhibited fascinating reproductive strategies.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the hologynic to understand its evolutionary advantages.
meanings.sent3: The hologynic in the lab escaped and caused chaos among the other specimens.
meanings.sent4: The ecosystem relied on the hologynic for its unique role in pollination.
meanings.sent5: In the forest, the hologynic stood out among the other organisms with its distinct features.
